result.execSummary:
The defendant Laraven C Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety By Use Of A Dangerous Weapon (Pointing)

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 5:00 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
No firearms.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 5:00 p.m. and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laraven C Burks

defendant.name: Burks, Laraven C

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laraven C Burks in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Laraven C Burks.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Court finds victim notification has been complied with.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 5:00 pm.
- No firearms.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 5:00 pm and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Defendant Laraven C Burks in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laraven C Burks in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laraven C Burks appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense has discovery and an offer and requests additional status date. Case adjourned to Br. 01.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-09-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CB, CW.

Defendant Laraven C Burks in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/07/2022@1:30p
